page.title: 08Homelife, Isle of Skye
page.content: Children in our community are very good at helping at home and outside the home. Most households have solid fuel fires on which coal,peat and wood are burnt. Coal is bought from a local supplier. Wood is bought from the forestry commission. Peat,which costs nothing but time and energy, is burned by nearly every household. Everyone helps from the cutting,to stacking,to bringing home for fuel. The same applies at sheep-shearing and dipping time. People help each other thus enabling the work to be done quicker. Nearly every family has a cat,a dog or usually both. Life here is much more relaxed than in the town or city. Life is also much healthier. People seem to have more time for each other. People here spend a lot of time working outside every day.
